text: Lung microbiome studies suggest that bacteria colonizing the LRT overlap with those found in the URT , but that the abundance of organisms is quite low [ 13 ] , and their role in pneumonia etiology has yet to be explored . To colonize the LRT , an organism must overcome mucociliary clearance and phagocytosis by resident alveolar macrophages , neutrophils and monocyte - derived macrophages [ 37 , 38 ] , but many URT pathogens have developed strategies to overcome these barriers . H . influenzae , Mycoplasma pneumoniae and Bordetella pertussis resist mucociliary clearance by impairing ciliary function .
